_meanings:
{@--1@} To step or go 
towards, approach, resort or betake
oneself to; {#umAmuKaM tu pratipadya lolA#}
{#dvisaMSrayAM prItimavApa lakzmIH#} <ls>Ku. 1. 43.</ls>

{@--11@} To assent or agree to,
consent; {#taTeti matipannAya#} <ls>R. 15. 93.</ls>

{@--12@} To do, perform, practise, 
observe; {#AcAraM pratipadyasva#} <ls>Ś. 4</ls>; <ls>V. 2</ls>
‘do the formal obeisance’;  
{#SAsanamarhatAM pratipadyaDvaM#} <ls>Mu. 4. 18</ls> act up to or
obey.’

{@--16@} To know, 
understand, become acquainted with,
learn, discover.

{@--2@} To
substantiate, prove, establish by
proof; {#uktamevArTamudAharaRena pratipAdayati#}.

{@--4@} To bring
or lead back, convey or transport (to
a place).

{@--6@}
To assert, declare to be, represent.
